text: Fun hack!! If you want to copy and paste fields in HubSpot, you can do so by editing the “fields” JSON file in the HubSpot FTP. That way, if you have a bunch of design manager fields all set up, and don’t want to go through the trouble of remaking them in a new module (or you have a module set up with other fields, and can’t clone the other module).
“Fields” is just a JSON object.
Edit, copy and paste away!
HubSpot FTP instructions are here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp>
So use case scenario is this: You have two modules that you want to smash together with a bunch of fields that you don’t want to have to do over.
I may have spoke too soon. It seems like the server will only accept very minor changes to the file, otherwise the file transfer fails.

Speaking of FTP, it would be awesome to have the ability to manage templates from here, like we can with the File Manager. I don't want to be able to edit them or anything just to more easily organize templates, folder structures and rearrange them. Portals that have a ton of templates in them can be somewhat burdensome to manage from within HubSpot Design Manager.

I thought I heard at INBOUND that any existing Marketing Hub client who did not already have the CMS would have the ability to "add it" and not pay until they were ready to take the website live? I just checked a client portal and all it's giving me is a "Buy Now" button. cc: <@U22PU4G4A> <@U3VN3LMME>
You should be able to make any number of changes. If the file transfer failed it would be due to a validation error or json formatting
when you copy over fields from another module make sure to remove the field IDs

Hey Josh. Currently you can't spin-up a CMS trial for existing customers, but you can spin-up a portal for new leads you have registered in your portal. We're going to work on fixing the ability to do this for existing customers.
Here's a Loom from <@U3VN3LMME> though on how to do this for a lead: <https://www.useloom.com/share/0dc53e9eeaa842a5ba92b50232582b9b>
I’m building a video listing page using hubDB, you can view the video listing page here: <https://www.graywolfranch.com/video>. The issue that I’m having is my 4th video is being given a left margin
here is a screenshot of the code:
is there a better way to to structure this code to eliminate the margin on on the second row?
Anyone know why these items are in the to-do column when I've done all of them already – why is it not seeing the H1 tag / meta post body, etc. ?
you’re using span4's. all span4s after the first one will have a margin to create the gap between the columns
you use nth child or more happily use flexbox/grid to lay out the videos
I might be wrong, but I think it only runs the tests every so often for performance reasons so it might have a  delay.
Hmm – it's just odd it wouldn't recognize meta info or h1 tags
is there something I need to include in the header so that the meta info gets passed from the CMS to the template?
I don’t think so - the tester tests the full pages html I think.
Hi <@U795QFHDE> - that looks like it could be a bug, we do look at the page externally
thanks <@U7SL518D6>

Ok. So if an existing HubSpot customer wants to now add the CMS, they have to pay for it right away? We have a redesign project starting today that is going to be on the CMS but they don't currently have the CMS add-on. But they do have a portal for their CRM and Marketing Hub.
Hmm. I’m guessing a validation error. The failed change was changing “80px” to “40px” as a test…
I was using Filezilla fyi. And yeah I tried copying JSON over and leaving the field ID, did not work either.
Are you able to successfully change fields and reupload via ftp? What client/OS do you use?
Guys, how can I pass the form data submitted to the “redirect URL” ? I need to embed the form JS and pass the submitted info the the thank you page.
<@UB1TT8UAE> you’re not going to like  this. it’s not easy
I’ve done this with Filezilla on MacOS but I believe we support all FTP clients. Could you DM me an example of this? maybe as video?
the best solution right now is to grab the fields on submit store a cookie and call the cookie on the page you land on
because the form data isn’t instantly updated in the CRM odds are the person would get there before that data is reference able through HubL on the thank you apge
I used the code and worked, but I’m checking if exist other way: (<https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/include-form-fields-as-redirect-url-parameters-on-an-embedded-form/3545/2>)
ahh yea that’s honestly a better way than through cookies
It’s been an ongoing conversation among the devs here for a long time. those 2 solutions are the ones everyone ends up using
Thanks, <@U7SL518D6>. Maybe HubSpot can create this feature in the Forms Setting, easy as OptinMonster does: <https://optinmonster.com/docs/passing-lead-data-to-redirect-urls-in-optinmonster/>

Correct, an existing customer would need to purchase the add-on right away. You can spin-up a portal for new customers then they start paying when they want to take the site live. Again, we're going to fix that for existing customers though to make it work in a similar way, or at least have a trial.
Should be fixed now

open-source documentation is an amazing idea... this has come up a few times when planning out the CMS Developer Program. Having documentation tiers: "HubSpot Created", "Community Created, HubSpot Verified", and "Community Submitted"
 - With community ratings and comments.
The "Community Code Gallery" we're scoping out now (alpha in Q4) will have a lot of this built in. But will be much more focused on specific things built on HubSpot.
<@U6GNQ7JBU> is this feasible? Seems like a great solution
LOVE seeing this community dev / HubSpot collaboration... :slightly_smiling_face: #KeepGoing
I'd check with Julianna who runs the HUGS program <mailto:jbnicholson@HubSpot.com|jbnicholson@HubSpot.com>

I'd search around on <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/forums/searchpage/tab/message?advanced=false&allow_punctuation=false&q=menu>

or here <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/forums/searchpage/tab/message?advanced=false&allow_punctuation=false&q=mega%20menu>

Probably some examples in there.
:point_up_2: Post and upvote in <http://ideas.HubSpot.com|ideas.HubSpot.com> :slightly_smiling_face:

While i support the ideas forum it’s built in such a way it kind of excludes development stuff (no appropriate categories to post in, and because its currently built aimed at the marketers any of our posts there get completely buried. Ive had postings there for years that didn’t get responses from HS but got upvotes from a small group of devs.)

I think work needs to be done to make that work for devs too.

Meanwhile the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel on slack has had a more noticeable effect for devs posting ideas. Though a slack channel isn’t the best as it only allows people to upvote an idea within a week or so as the chat history doesn’t last very long, and it’s a chatroom so if say someone posts something a few days ago and more ideas get posted today, the ideas from days ago get kinda buried.
Ah bummer. Ok. Thanks.
